PIC32CX-BZ Zigbee API Reference
Functions
Watch Dog timer
HAL functions

Functions for controlling a Watch Dog timer: if such timer is started for a certain period of time or is not stopped or reset during this period, then device's hardware is reset. More...

Functions

void HAL_StartWdt (HAL_WdtInterval_t interval)
 Starts the watch dog timer with a given interval.
void HAL_RegisterWdtCallback (void(*wdtCallback)(void))
 Registers a callback function called by the watch dog timer when it expires, before invoking hardware reset.

Detailed Description

Functions for controlling a Watch Dog timer: if such timer is started for a certain period of time or is not stopped or reset during this period, then device's hardware is reset.

Function Documentation

void HAL_StartWdt ( HAL_WdtInterval_t  interval)

Starts the watch dog timer with a given interval.

Parameters:
[in]interval- the time interval that may be chosen from:
WDT_INTERVAL_16 // 16 ms
WDT_INTERVAL_32 // 32 ms
WDT_INTERVAL_64 // 64 ms
WDT_INTERVAL_125 // 125 ms
WDT_INTERVAL_250 // 250 ms
WDT_INTERVAL_500 // 500 ms
WDT_INTERVAL_1000 // 1 second
WDT_INTERVAL_2000 // 2 seconds
WDT_INTERVAL_4000 // 4 seconds
WDT_INTERVAL_8000 // 8 seconds
void HAL_RegisterWdtCallback ( void(*)(void)  wdtCallback)

Registers a callback function called by the watch dog timer when it expires, before invoking hardware reset.

As soon as the callback function completes, hardware reset is invoked.

Note that function is empty for XMEGA-based platforms, since there is no WDT interrupt vector for such platforms.

Parameters:
[in]wdtCallback- pointer to a callback function
